title: What We Do: Digital Learning Experience - STLA - SIT

meta.description: Learn how the Digital Learning Experience team – comprising of instructional designers and media producers – craft engaging learning experiences in consultation and collaboration with educational developers and academic staff.

text_lines: Learn how the Digital Learning Experience team – comprising of instructional designers and media producers – craft engaging learning experiences in consultation and collaboration with educational developers and academic staff.
Our team of instructional designers create online learning solutions that are aligned with competency-based learning outcomes. We do this by:
Collaborating with educational developers and academic staff to design and implement purposeful assessments that provide meaningful feedback and measure learners’ progress and achievement.
Suggesting and using appropriate technology to support the delivery of our online lessons.
Managing project timelines and ensuring that all deliverables are completed on time and within budget, while maintaining high standards of quality and consistency.
Incorporating data and feedback to evaluate the quality and impact of our curriculum, and to continuously improve them based on learners’ needs and expectations.

Knowledge transfer, retention and application are largely dependent on the context, the content, the pedagogy, the technology, the assessment, and the individual characteristics of both academic staff and learners.
To enhance the online teaching and learning experience, our instructional designers also work hand-in-hand with our media production team.
Our media production team develops educational media resources in consultation with our teams of instructional designers and educational developers, and in collaboration with academic staff.

We develop media resources in the form of eLearning packages, videos, infographics, animations, and extended reality (XR) content, so as to bring mundane or complex theories to life and inspire greater student engagement.

We develop our media resources using a structured process that involves academic staff and other stakeholders. This ensures that the resources will be able to cater to varied teaching and learning needs.
Want to produce your own media resources?
Make use of our media equipment and studio facilities to produce high-quality media content for your lessons. We also conduct workshops for you to learn how to use these tools.

"I would like to say ‘Thank You’ to the STLA media production team for their resourcefulness and excellent work in the production of these videos. Most of the students and CET participants found the videos very helpful in getting familiarised with the robot arm before attending the lab/hands-on session."
"The students were able to pick up skills quite fast. And all of the students were able to finish the orientation exercise and understand the basic functions."

"The content communicated through the videos increased the clarity of the research topics, aroused students’ interest in applied research, and were useful in helping students formulate research questions."
"They [the videos] are excellent pre-reading materials prior to practical [lessons]. This [motivates] students to be proactive in learning."
"We can see that the professors have put in a lot of effort, even in acting. The videos were useful in helping us formulate the research questions."
"It was great to be able to replay the demonstrations when revising for our Objective Structured Clinical Examination (OSCE)."
"The videos explain the procedures very clearly and were easy to understand."
"I feel more prepared going into the lab because I have watched the package. Saves time."

article_texts:
Digital Learning Experience
Learn how the Digital Learning Experience team – comprising of instructional designers and media producers – craft engaging learning experiences in consultation and collaboration with educational developers and academic staff.
Instructional Design
Our team of instructional designers create online learning solutions that are aligned with competency-based learning outcomes. We do this by:
Collaborating with educational developers and academic staff to design and implement purposeful assessments that provide meaningful feedback and measure learners’ progress and achievement.
Suggesting and using appropriate technology to support the delivery of our online lessons.
Managing project timelines and ensuring that all deliverables are completed on time and within budget, while maintaining high standards of quality and consistency.
Incorporating data and feedback to evaluate the quality and impact of our curriculum, and to continuously improve them based on learners’ needs and expectations.
Types of Projects We Handle
Knowledge transfer, retention and application are largely dependent on the context, the content, the pedagogy, the technology, the assessment, and the individual characteristics of both academic staff and learners.
To enhance the online teaching and learning experience, our instructional designers also work hand-in-hand with our media production team.
chevron--up
Educational Media Production
Our media production team develops educational media resources in consultation with our teams of instructional designers and educational developers, and in collaboration with academic staff.
We develop media resources in the form of eLearning packages, videos, infographics, animations, and extended reality (XR) content, so as to bring mundane or complex theories to life and inspire greater student engagement.
Our Resource Development Process
We develop our media resources using a structured process that involves academic staff and other stakeholders. This ensures that the resources will be able to cater to varied teaching and learning needs.
View some of our collaborations
chevron--up
Want to produce your own media resources?
Make use of our media equipment and studio facilities to produce high-quality media content for your lessons. We also conduct workshops for you to learn how to use these tools.
VIEW OUR EQUIPMENT INVENTORY
